ul.li1: 1My child, if you will receiveOr “take, seize” my sayings,
ul.li2: and hide my commands with you,
ul.li1: 2in order to incline your ear toward wisdom,
ul.li2: then you shall apply your heart to understanding.
ul.li1: 3For if you cry out for understanding,Or “call to understanding”
ul.li2: if you liftOr “carry, give” your voice for insight,
ul.li1: 4if you seek her like silver
ul.li2: and search her out like treasure,Literally “like the treasures”
ul.li1: 5then you will understand the fear of Yahweh,
ul.li2: and the knowledge of God you will find.
ul.li1: 6For Yahweh will give wisdom;
ul.li2: from his mouth come knowledge and understanding.
ul.li1: 7For the upright, he storesOr “hides, keeps” sound judgment, a shield for those who walk uprightly,
8in order to guard paths of justice
ul.li2: and keepOr “preserve, guard, watch” the way of his faithful ones.
ul.li1: 9Then you will understand righteousness and justice
ul.li2: and uprightness—every good course—
ul.li1: 10for wisdom will enter your heart,
ul.li2: and knowledge will be pleasing to your soul.Or “inner self”
ul.li1: 11Discretion will watch over you;
ul.li2: understanding will protect you,
ul.li1: 12in order to deliver you from the way of evil,Or “evildoer”
ul.li2: from a man who speaks devious things—
ul.li1: 13those who forsake the paths of uprightness
ul.li2: to walk in ways of darkness,
ul.li1: 14those who are happy to do evil,
ul.li2: for they delight in the deviousness of evil,
ul.li1: 15who are crooked in their ways,Literally “that in their ways are crooked”
ul.li2: and devious in their paths;
ul.li1: 16in order to deliver you from a strange woman,
ul.li2: from a foreign woman who flattersOr “makes smooth” with her sayings,
ul.li1: 17she who forsakes the partner of her youth
ul.li2: and has forgotten the covenant of her God,
ul.li1: 18for her house sinks to death,
ul.li2: and to the deadOr “Rephaim” are her paths.
ul.li1: 19Of all who go to her, none shall return,
ul.li2: nor do they reach paths of life.
ul.li1: 20So that you will walk on the road of those who are good,
ul.li2: and the paths of those who are righteous you shall keep.
ul.li1: 21For those who are upright will dwell in the land,Or “earth”
ul.li2: and those who are blamelessOr “innocent” will remain in it.
ul.li1: 22And those who are wicked will be cut off from the land,
ul.li2: and those who are treacherous will be uprooted from it.
